Welcome to Postshare REST API’s documentation!¶

Postshare REST API repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.create_comment(db: Session, post_id: int, comment_data: CommentModel, user: User) → Comment¶

Function to create comment.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Connection to database

  • post_id – int: Unique identifier of post

  • comment_data – CommentModel: Information to comment

  • user – User: Author of the comment

Returns:

Comment

async src.repository.comments.delete_comment(db: Session, comment_id: int) → Comment | None¶

Function to delete comment.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

  • comment_id – int: Unique identifier of post

Returns:

Comment | None

async src.repository.comments.get_comment(db: Session, comment_id: int) → Comment | None¶

Function to get comment.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

  • comment_id – int: Unique identifier of post

Returns:

Comment | None

async src.repository.comments.get_comments_for_post(post_id: int, db: Session) → List[Comment] | None¶

Function to get comments for post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Unique identifier of post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

List[Comment] | None

async src.repository.comments.update_comment(db: Session, comment_id: int, comment_data: CommentModel, user: User) → Comment | None¶

Function to update comment.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

  • comment_id – int: Unique identifier of post

  • comment_data – CommentModel: information to comment

  • user – User: Author of the comment

Returns:

Comment | None

Postshare REST API repository Posts¶

async src.repository.posts.add_post(post_url: str, public_id: str, description: str, user: User, db: Session) → Post¶

Function to add post.

Parameters:

  • post_url – str: Url of the post

  • public_id – str: Public id of the post

  • description – str: Description of the post

  • user – User: Author of the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Post

async src.repository.posts.add_tag_to_post(post: Post, tag: Tag, db: Session) → Post¶

Function to add tag to post.

Parameters:

  • post – Post: The post to which the tag is added

  • tag – Tag: Tag that is added to the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Post

async src.repository.posts.add_transformed_post(transformed_post_url: str, post_id: int, db: Session) → TransformedPost¶

Function to add transformed post.

Parameters:

  • transformed_post_url – str: Url of the transformed post

  • post_id – int: id of the post we are transforming

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

TransformedPost

async src.repository.posts.delete_post(post_id: int, db: Session) → Post | None¶

Function to delete post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: id of the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Post | None

async src.repository.posts.edit_description(post_id: int, description: str, db: Session) → Post | None¶

Function to edit post description.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: id of the post

  • description – str: Description of the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Post | None

async src.repository.posts.get_all_posts(current_user: User, db: Session, keyword: str = None, tag: str = None, min_rating: float = None, max_rating: float = None)¶

Search all posts in the database based on the provided filters such as keyword, tag, minimum and maximum rating.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: The user making the request.

  • db – Session: Database session.

  • keyword – str, optional: Keyword to filter posts by description.

  • tag – str, optional: Tag to filter posts.

  • min_rating – float, optional: Minimum rating to filter posts.

  • max_rating – float, optional: Maximum rating to filter posts.

Returns:

PostsByFilter: Response containing the list of filtered posts.

async src.repository.posts.get_my_posts(user: User, db: Session) → List[Post]¶

Function to get current user’s posts.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Author of the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

List[Post]

async src.repository.posts.get_post(post_id: int, db: Session) → Post | None¶

Function to get post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: id of the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Post | None

async src.repository.posts.get_post_by_url(post_url: str, db: Session) → Post | None¶

Function to get post by url.

Parameters:

  • post_url – str: Url of the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Post | None

async src.repository.posts.get_post_url(post_id: int, db: Session) → Column[str] | None¶

Function to get post url.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: id of the post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Column[str] | None: Url of the post

async src.repository.posts.get_transformed_post_by_url(transformed_post_url: str, db: Session) → TransformedPost | None¶

Function to get transformed post by url.

Parameters:

  • transformed_post_url – str: Url of the transformed post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Transformed post | None

async src.repository.posts.get_transformed_post_url(transformed_post_id: int, db: Session) → Column[str] | None¶

Function to get transformed post url.

Parameters:

  • transformed_post_id – int: id of the transformed post

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Column[str] | None: Url of the transformed post

Postshare REST API repository Rating¶

async src.repository.rating.calculate_average_rating(post_id: int, db: Session) → Decimal¶

Function to calculate average rating for the post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: id of the post which the rating is calculated

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

Decimal: Average rating for the post as a decimal number

async src.repository.rating.create_rating(db: Session, post_id: int, rating: int, user: User) → PostRating¶

Function to create new rating.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

  • post_id – int: id of the post being rated

  • rating – int: New rating value (1 to 5 stars)

  • user – User: Current user

Returns:

PostRating: Created Post rating

async src.repository.rating.delete_rating(post_id: int, user_id: int, db: Session) → PostRating¶

Function to delete the rating given by a specific user to a specific post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: id of the post which the rating is calculated

  • user_id – int: id of the user who gave the rating

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

PostRating: Deleted Post rating

async src.repository.rating.get_user_ratings(user_id: int, db: Session) → List[PostRating]¶

Function to get ratings given by a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: id of the user who gave ratings

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

List[PostRating]: List of ratings left by the user

Postshare REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.add_to_blacklist(token: str, db: Session) → None¶

Add a token to the blacklist.

Parameters:

  • token – str: The JWT that is being blacklisted.

  • db – Session: SQLAlchemy session object for accessing the database

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.ban_user(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Function to ban user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Email

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

User | None

async src.repository.users.change_role(email: str, role: UserRole, db: Session) → User | None¶

Function to change role.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Email

  • role – UserRole: Role of user

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

User | None

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Email of the user we want to confirm

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Information to create a user

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

User object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Email of the user we want to get

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

User: The first user found in the database that matches the given email

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_id(user_id: int, db: Session) → User | None¶

Function to get user by id.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: User id

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

User | None

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_username(username: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Function to get user by username.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Name of user

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

User | None

async src.repository.users.get_user_profile(user: User, db: Session) → UserProfile | None¶

Function to get user profile.

Parameters:

  • user – User: User

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

UserProfile | None

async src.repository.users.is_blacklisted_token(token: str, db: Session) → bool¶

Check if a token is blacklisted.

Parameters:

  • token – str: The JWT that is being blacklisted.

  • db – Session: SQLAlchemy session object for accessing the database

Returns:

bool

async src.repository.users.unban_user(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Function to unban user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Email

  • db – Session: Connection session to database

Returns:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Email of the user whose avatar needs to be changed

  • url – str | None: New avatar url

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

User: The updated user

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: User for whom the token needs to be updated

  • token – str | None: The refreshed token

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

None

Postshare REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Confirmation token

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

dict: A message if the email is already confirmed or confirms the email

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: The username and password

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

dict: A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

async src.routes.auth.logout(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Logout a user.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: SQLAlchemy session object for accessing the database

  • current_user – UserModel: the current user

Returns:

dict: JSON message

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access token, a new refresh token, and the type of authorization.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: HTTP authorization credentials that contain a refresh token

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

dict: A new access_token and refresh_token for the user

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send a confirmation email to the user.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Email of the user we want to confirm

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Background task to run

  • request – Request: The base url of the request

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

dict: A message that tells the user to check their email for confirmation

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database. It takes in a UserModel object, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored as such.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Information to create a user

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Background task to run

  • request – Request: The base url of the request

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

dict: A dictionary with the user and a detail message

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Postshare REST API routes Posts¶

async src.routes.posts.add_post(request: Request, file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), description: str = '', db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to add new post.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: HTTP request

  • file – UploadFile: Upload image file

  • description – str: Description of post

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

Post

async src.routes.posts.delete_post(request: Request, post_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to delete post.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: HTTP request

  • post_id – int: Post id

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

Post

async src.routes.posts.edit_description(request: Request, post_id: int, description: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to edit post description.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: HTTP request

  • post_id – int: Post id

  • description – str: New post description

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

Post

async src.routes.posts.get_my_posts(request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to get posts belonging to the current user.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: HTTP request

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

list[PostResponse]: List of posts

async src.routes.posts.get_post(request: Request, post_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to get post.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: HTTP request

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Param:

post_id: int: Post id

Returns:

PostResponse: Post

async src.routes.posts.get_post_qrcode(post_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to get post qrcode.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Post id

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

StreamingResponse

async src.routes.posts.search_posts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db), keyword: str = Query(None), tag: str = Query(None), min_rating: int = Query(None), max_rating: int = Query(None))¶

Function to get a list of messages based on the provided filters.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: The currently authenticated user

  • db – Session: The database session

  • keyword – str, optional: A keyword to search for in the post’s title or description

  • tag – str, optional: A tag to filter posts by

  • min_rating – int, optional: The minimum rating for the posts to be returned

  • max_rating – int, optional: The maximum rating for the posts to be returned

Returns:

PostsByFilter

Postshare REST API routes Rating¶

async src.routes.rating.create_rating(post_id: int, rating: int = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to create a new rating for a specific post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: The id of the post to rate.

  • rating – int, optional: The rating value from 1 to 5 stars

  • db – Session: The database session

  • current_user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

RatingResponse

async src.routes.rating.delete_rating(post_id: int, user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a rating for a specific post by a user.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: The ID of the post to delete the rating for

  • user_id – int: The ID of the user whose rating is to be deleted

  • db – Session: The database session

  • current_user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

RatingResponse

async src.routes.rating.get_post_rating(post_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve the average rating of a specific post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: The id of the post to retrieve the average rating for

  • db – Session: The database session

  • current_user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

AverageRatingResponse

async src.routes.rating.get_user_ratings(user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve all ratings made by a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: The ID of the user to retrieve the ratings for

  • db – Session: The database session

  • current_user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

List[RatingResponse]

Postshare REST API routes Transformations¶

async src.routes.transformations.add_filter(request: Request, post_id: int, filter: Literal['al_dente', 'athena', 'audrey', 'aurora', 'daguerre', 'eucalyptus', 'fes', 'frost', 'hairspray', 'hokusai', 'incognito', 'linen', 'peacock', 'primavera', 'quartz', 'red_rock', 'refresh', 'sizzle', 'sonnet', 'ukulele', 'zorro'], db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to apply a filter to a specific post and generate a QR code for the transformed post URL.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: HTTP request

  • post_id – int: Post id

  • filter – Literal: The name of the filter to apply

  • db – Session: The database session

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

StreamingResponse: QR code image for the transformed post URL

async src.routes.transformations.resize(request: Request, post_id: int, width: int, height: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Function to resize post and generate a QR code for the transformed post URL.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: HTTP request

  • post_id – int: Post id

  • width – int: Post width

  • height – int: Post height

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

StreamingResponse: QR code image for the transformed post URL

Postshare REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It uses the auth_service to retrieve the current user, and returns it if found.

Parameters:

user – User: Current user

Returns:

The user object

async src.routes.users.get_user_by_id(user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶

Function to get user profile.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: User id

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

Returns:

User object

async src.routes.users.get_user_profile(username: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Function to get user profile.

Parameters:

  • username – str: User name

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

User object

async src.routes.users.manage_user(username: str, action: Action, role: UserRole = UserRole.user, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Function to manage a user’s role or ban status.

Parameters:

  • username – str: The username of the user to manage

  • action – Action: The action to perform. This can be ‘change_user_role’, ‘ban’, or ‘unban’

  • role – UserRole, optional: The new role to assign to the user

  • user – User: The currently authenticated user

  • db – Session: The database session

Returns:

UserResponse

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Image for a new avatar

  • user – User: Current user

  • db – Session: Connection to the database

Returns:

User: The updated user
